articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Former NFL Viking, retired Minnesota Supreme Court Justice Alan Page awarded Presidential Medal of Freedom
articles.description: Donald Trump has awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom to former NFL star and Minnesota Supreme Court Justice, Judge Alan Page. Joy Reid and Page discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Dana Milbank: McConnell combines this sort of naked pursuit of power without principle with some real cunning
articles.description: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell now calls for bipartisanship after years of obstructing former president Barack Obama’s agenda. Joy Reid and her panel discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trita Parsi: Trump administration has essentially turned into Saudi Crown Prince's lawyer
articles.description: The White House has reportedly considered extraditing a Turkish cleric who is a foe of Turkish president Tayyip Erdogan in the wake of the murder of Turkish journalist Jamal Khashoggi, allegedly by agents of the Saudi Arabian government. Joy Reid and her pane…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rashad Robinson: Stacey Abrams has charted course for how Democrats need to stand up
articles.description: Stacey Abrams acknowledged Brian Kemp as Georgia governor-elect, but added ‘this is not a speech of concession.’ Joy Reid and her panel discuss voter suppression in Georgia and beyond.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Donna F. Edwards: It's important to have leadership that knows what it's doing
articles.description: Rep. Nancy Pelosi is being challenged in the race for Speaker of the House by Rep. Marcia Fudge and more. Does Pelosi have the votes to regain the gavel? Joy Reid and her panel discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Cynthia Alksne: Assange could be indicted for hacking into election
articles.description: Julian Assange will be charged according to mistakenly filed court documents, but it remains unclear what those charges will be, and how exactly they may relate to Robert Mueller’s Russia investigation. Joy Reid and her panel discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: EXCLUSIVE: Lawyer for WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange Speaks Out on possible criminal charges
articles.description: Jennifer Robinson, lawyer for WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, speaks exclusively with MSNBC’s Keir Simmons about his possible arrest as a key figure in Mueller’s Russia investigation.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Fmr. Deputy Natl. Security Advisor: The WH knows more than its saying on Khashoggi
articles.description: Former Deputy National Security Advisor Ben Rhodes breaks down why he thinks the White House may know more than they’re saying in regards to the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Former Trump Campaign Aide: “Donald’s Not Loyal”
articles.description: Former Trump Campaign Aide Sam Nunberg and Philippe Reines  give their altering opinions on Roger Stone and the Russia meetings.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: “Frankly the evidence is not there,” Noah Rothman on Stacey Abram's claims that the Ga. election was illegitimate.
articles.description: MSNBC contributor Noah Rothman and Brooklyn NAACP President L. Joy Williams debate whether or not Stacey Abrams has plausible evidence in regards to whether or not the Ga. Election was run fairly.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Does having a Mar-a-Lago membership qualify you to become a diplomat?
articles.description: MSNBCs David Gura discusses what it takes… or costs… to become an ambassador in the Trump Administration.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Does President Trump know something about the Russia investigation that the rest of us do not?
articles.description: MSNBCs David Gura discusses what it takes… or costs… to become an ambassador in the Trump Administration.

articles.title: Maddow's 'Betrayal' special takes a peek inside LBJ's 'X File'
articles.description: Rachel Maddow alerts viewers to the debut airing of a new documentary called Betrayal, about a secret effort to extend the war in Vietnam in order to help Richard Nixon get elected.

articles.title: Programming note! 'Betrayal' documentary airs Sunday at 9pm ET
articles.description: Rachel Maddow alerts viewers to the debut airing of a new documentary called Betrayal, about a secret effort to extend the war in Vietnam in order to help Richard Nixon get elected.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Trump aims to placate Turkey to cover Saudis on Khashoggi killing
articles.description: David Laufman, former Department of Justice official, talks with Rachel Maddow about what is unusual about the Trump administration's consideration of handing a Turkish exile residing in the U.S. to Turkey for certain persecution in a bid to ease pressure on …

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Whitaker disqualifications run deeper than sketchy work history
articles.description: Rachel Maddow shares the latest reporting on Donald Trump's acting-attorney general pick, Matt Whitaker, that make his qualifications seem that much more dubious, including Senator Mark Warner's concerns about a conflict with the Mueller investigation because…

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Stacey Abrams, beaten but not defeated, vows voting rights fight
articles.description: Rachel Maddow reports on Democratic gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams' non-concession speech in which she acknowledged that she was out of legal options to contest Brian Kemp's victory, but vowed continued legal action over Georgia's voting rights abuses …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: California firefighters to Trump: 'You are wrong' about wildfires
articles.description: Trump said he's heading to California 'just to visit the firefighters' before misrepresenting the number of people who have died in California's deadly wildfires. Jon Meacham joins to discuss the difficulty Trump faces in the role of consoler-in-chief.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: NBC News: CIA concludes Saudi crown prince order Khashoggi murder
articles.description: The CIA has found that Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman ordered the assassination of journalist Jamal Khashoggi. Trump's resistanted directly blaming Saudi Arabia putting the White House in a difficult position. The Washington Post's Greg Miller joins.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Joyce Vance: A perjury trap is a unicorn defense attorneys chase
articles.description: Trump again brought up the concept of a 'perjury trap' when asked about the questions he is answering from Robert Mueller. But do perjury traps really exist? We asked former federal prosecutor Joyce Vance.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Waiting for the hammer to fall: Trump signals Mueller probe's end
articles.description: Trump denied reports of his fury and a White House in chaos saying of the Mueller investigation, 'I imagine it's ending' before adding it 'will be just fine.' So when will Mueller make his next move? Josh Gerstein, Joyce Vance, & Daniel Goldman discuss.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: CIA assessment: Saudi crown prince ordered Khashoggi hit
articles.description: A CIA assessment has determined that Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman ordered the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi and the Washington Post reports that Trump “has been shown evidence of the prince’s involvement, but remains skeptical.”   Joy Reid d…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Tony Schwartz on Trump's ‘delusions’ & ‘rage’
articles.description: Donald Trump is reportedly furious after Republicans’ midterm losses and anxious about the Mueller probe.  Tony Schwartz, the co-author of Trump's book, tells Joy Reid how the midterms and the Mueller probe have destroyed Trump's identity as a winner.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Donald Trump makes some questionable Ambassador picks
articles.description: Trump tries and fails to get the NSC staffer Melania fired to go to Estonia. Meanwhile, exotic handbag designer and Mar-a-Lago member Lana Marks is officially nominated to be Ambassador to South Africa.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Hayes: Assange charges have 'huge' implications
articles.description: Undisclosed criminal charges against Julian Assange, with potentially huge implications, were accidentally discovered.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Behind political curtain, immigration policy changes
articles.description: Behind the political theater of troops at the border, Trump is making significant changes to immigration policy.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Nancy Pelosi's speaker fight goes back to 2012
articles.description: Six years ago, Rep. Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) found herself answering the same questions about "younger leadership" that she faces now.

articles.title: NYT: Trump questioning Pence’s loyalty
articles.description: The New York Times is reporting that in recent weeks the president has asked his aides and advisers - Is Mike Pence loyal?

articles.title: The Supremes’ Mary Wilson tells Millennials to fall back!
articles.description: Founding member of “The Supremes”, Mary Wilson, Attorney Maya Wiley and former Executive Editor of “The New York Times”, Howell Raines, join Ari Melber for Fallback Friday on “The Beat”. Wilson calls out millennials for their poor manners, Wiley blasts Democr…

articles.title: Bombshell: Legal pressure on central Mueller probe figure Assange
articles.description: A slip up from a prosecutor reveals prosecutors are preparing criminal charges against Wikileaks founder Julian Assange. It is unclear whether the charges relate to Wikileaks’ 2010 publishing of secret diplomatic cables, its leak of material from Russian hack…

articles.title: Sam Nunberg spills on Mueller probe Grand Jury questions
articles.description: President Trump confirms he is taking Special Counsel Mueller’s questions on collusion and providing written answers. Trump stressed that he himself was answering the questions, not his lawyers. Watergate Prosecutor Nick Akerman tells Ari Melber “no decent la…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Chico, California Mayor on wildfires: It’s catastrophic
articles.description: The Camp Fire is now California's deadliest and most destructive fire in the state's history leaving apocalyptic landscapes in its wake.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen Blumenthal: Trump acting like he’s caught
articles.description: NBC News recently reported that "A court document filed by mistake has revealed that the Justice Department is preparing to criminally charge Assange."

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Trump says he finished writing answers to Mueller's questions
articles.description: Trump weighed in on one of the most contentious aspects of Mueller's investigation, announcing he'd completed his written answers to questions in the Russia probe. The answers haven't been submitted yet.
